Sentencas: Manganese cobalt spinel oxides are promising materials for protective coatings for solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) interconnects.
Titulo: Effect of coating density on oxidation resistance and Cr vaporization from solid oxide fuel cell interconnects

Sentencas: To achieve high density such coatings are often sintered in a two-step procedure, involving heat treatment first in reducing and then in oxidizing atmospheres.
Titulo: Effect of coating density on oxidation resistance and Cr vaporization from solid oxide fuel cell interconnects

Sentencas: Sintering the coating inside the SOFC stack during heating would reduce production costs, but may result in a lower coating, density.
Titulo: Effect of coating density on oxidation resistance and Cr vaporization from solid oxide fuel cell interconnects

Sentencas: The importance of coating density is here assessed by characterization of the oxidation kinetics and Cr evaporation of Crofer 22 APU with MnCo1.7Fe0.3O4 spinel coatings of different density.
Titulo: Effect of coating density on oxidation resistance and Cr vaporization from solid oxide fuel cell interconnects

Sentencas: The coating density is shown to have minor influence on the long-term oxidation behavior in air at 800 degrees C, evaluated over 5000 h. Sintering the spinel coating in air at 900 degrees C, equivalent to an in-situ heat treatment, leads to an 88% reduction of the Cr evaporation rate of Crofer 22 APU in air-3% H2O at 800 degrees C.
Titulo: Effect of coating density on oxidation resistance and Cr vaporization from solid oxide fuel cell interconnects

Sentencas: The air sintered spinel coating is initially highly porous, however, densifies with time in interaction with the alloy.
Titulo: Effect of coating density on oxidation resistance and Cr vaporization from solid oxide fuel cell interconnects

Sentencas: A two-step reduction and re-oxidation heat treatment results in a denser coating, which reduces Cr evaporation by 97%.
Titulo: Effect of coating density on oxidation resistance and Cr vaporization from solid oxide fuel cell interconnects
